title: having problems with 1 - 2 second in-game screen freezes
body: I had this problem a little while ago but it sort of went away for a while, now however it returned and worse this time (only in my most recent game though). I had a game not so long ago and during the lane phase I experienced some quite long game freezes .. i'm pretty sure this isn't lag or FPS drops because they are usually very stable and I they feel quite different. its just like for a few seconds everything just stops not like idle animations .. it just all freezes up .. like no motion at all .. I'm not sure if this is a game fault of my computers .. but if anyone else is having these problems or know how to fix it, please comment below :) Thank you.

replies.body: What OS do you use, and what are the specifications of your computer (including graphics card)?
I am on Windows 8.1 pro with a 2.5GHz I5 processor, 4GB RAM, Nvidia GT 635M with 2GB VRAM. 64 bit

Your computer shouldn't be struggling to play league at all, even on the higher graphics settings.

It *might* be related to the new summoner's rift general sloppiness, but it doesn't seem this bad for most people.

Have you made sure to turn off automatic maintenence and updates from the settings of Windows? They usually cause hang like that.
Thanks for all your help! It is much appreciated :)
No problem, man. But for future reference, what exactly was it that you did which fixed your problem?

nothing really it just went away ... like it hasn't happened once since :) although I am pretty sure it has to do with other programs running in the background like it would always do it 100% of the time if chrome was open by mistake or such like, basically I just have to make sure nothing is going on while I play LoL :)

Oki doki. I do not like how Microsoft has reduced the transparency of what exactly's running on your computer for the sake of "minimal user interaction", but EH.

Anyway, have fun with League again!
